intro: Ensete ruandense, commonly known as the African banana, is a large, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Musaceae family and is characterized by its tall, clustered pseudostems and large, broad leaves. The plant produces inflorescences that develop into edible fruits, which are typically consumed when green. Ensete ruandense is adapted to grow in wet, lowland areas and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
